para.text: For the most part, an applet can be debugged just like any normal application within a standard Dolphin development

. Most applets will be able to run as standard applications anyway and so can be debugged in the traditional manner. However, some applets may wish to make use of specific web browser features or, for some other reasons, may only run within a web browser environment. In such situations it is important to be able to debug an applet

para.text: Fortunately, debugging an applet within a web browser is very straightforward. The key is to specify a normal development image for the plug-in to use when running the applet. This can be done using the IMAGE attribute of your applet's EMBED tag. For example:

para.text: Using this tag will instruct the plug-in to load the indicated Dolphin image and then to import the applet's binary package into this as it starts. Note the quote marks surrounding the image file name; these are required because it contains spaces.
